page.title: 01IBSTOCK - A BRIEF HISTORY
page.content: IBSTOCK, OR IBBESTOCHE, AS IT WAS THEN SPELT, WAS MENTIONED IN THE ORIGINAL DOMESDAY BOOK OF 1086. THE NAME IS THOUGHT TO HAVE COME FROM AN OLD SAXON PERSONAL NAME "IBBA" AND "STOC", MEANING A PLACE OR STOCKADE. IMPORTANT EVENTS THIS CENTURY _ {1907 - AN ELEMENTARY COUNCIL SCHOOL { (JUNIORS) BUILT IN MELBOURNE { ROAD. { 1925 - SECONDARY SCHOOL OPENED - THE { 1ST SEPARATE SECONDARY SCHOOL { IN LEICESTERSHIRE. { 1928 - IBSTOCK PIT CLOSED BECAUSE OF { LARGE LAND FAULT NEARBY. { 1931 - IBSTOCK AND HEATHER STATION { CLOSED TO PASSENGERS. { 1963 - SECONDARY SCHOOL BECAME A { COMMUNITY COLLEGE. { 1985 - IBSTOCK POP. - ABOUT 6000.}
